item.title: FAA Air Transportation Modernization and Safety Improvement Act

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 229 - 173 (Roll no. 517). (text: CR H6590)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 229 - 173 (Roll no. 517).(text: CR H6590)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H6604)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 244 - 164 (Roll no. 516). (consideration: CR H6597, H6603)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H6603)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1606, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Dreier demanded the Yeas and Nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 1606 until a time to be announced.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1606.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H6589-6597)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 231.

It shall be in order to take from the Speaker's table the bill H.R. 1586 and to consider in the House, without intervention of any point of order, a motion offered by the Chair of the Committee on Appropriations or his designee that the House concur in the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to the bill. The Senate amendment and the motion shall be considered as read and the motion shall be debatable for one hour equally divided and controlled. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the motion to final adoption.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-584, by Ms. Slaughter.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-584, by Ms. Slaughter.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 1586) to modernize the air traffic control system, improve the safety, reliability, and availability of transportation by air in the United States, provide for modernization of the air traffic control system, reauthorize the Federal Aviation Administration.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 1586) to modernize the air traffic control system, improve the safety, reliability, and availability of transportation by air in the United States, provide for modernization of the air traffic control system, reauthorize the Federal Aviation Administration, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
